intro: Venidium hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy venidium, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Venidium hirsutum typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in wetlands and along stream banks. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually green or red in color.
